last_episode_to_air.name: One Day at a Time Reunion

name: One Day at a Time
overview: The misadventures of a divorced mother,  two teenage daughters, and new building superintendent in Indianapolis.

episodes.name: Ann's Decision
episodes.overview: Newly devorced and scared Ann Romono is up for her first decision. Her older daughter Julie wants to go on a camping trip with her friend and a couple of boys. Julie threatens to leave her mother and live with her Dad unless Ann says she can go.

episodes.name: Chicago Rendezvous
episodes.overview: Ann's new boyfriend invites her to spend the weekend with him.

episodes.name: Jealousy
episodes.overview: Ann fears the girls are rejecting her in favor of their father's steady girlfriend.

episodes.name: How to Succeed Without Trying
episodes.overview: Ann scolds Julie for flirting with her teacher at exam time.

episodes.name: David Loves Ann
episodes.overview: One evening after a date, David and Ann get cozy on the couch, but Barbara and Julie decide to put the kibosh on any intimacy.  However, David makes the decision that it is the perfect time to ask Ann to marry him and gives her one week to come up with the answer.  After two hours go by, he changes his mind and tries to get her to decide right away.

episodes.name: Julie's Best Friend
episodes.overview: Julie's new best friend is a stuck up rich girl and Julie quickly demands more expensive things like clothes and she also demands that Ann send her to a prestigious school.  Ann refuses to give in to Julie simply because she can't afford it but that's when David steps in offering to kick in some financial aid for the Romano/Cooper household.

episodes.name: Super Blues
episodes.overview: Ann is throwing a party in her apartment and has invited other tenants in the building.  She begins to go through pre-party panic and it doesn't help when Schneider drops in with whistles, joy buzzers and whoopee cushions, expecting an invitation but soon discovers he is not wanted.

episodes.name: All the Way
episodes.overview: Julie's boyfriend wants to stay out all night.

episodes.name: Fighting City Hall
episodes.overview: Angry over her phone bill, Ann writes a protest to the President and gets in hot water with the Secret Service.

episodes.name: David Plus Two
episodes.overview: Ann discovers David and a young woman in a state of dishabille.

episodes.name: Julie's Job
episodes.overview: Julie gets a waitress job in a grubby diner on the rough side of town.

episodes.name: The College Man
episodes.overview: Julie has a date with a college manâ€”who discovers a decided preference for Ann.

episodes.name: Father David
episodes.overview: The girls cajole David into chaperoning a party while Ann is away.

episodes.name: Dad Comes Back (1)
episodes.overview: Ann's ex-husband announces his plans to remarry. First of two parts.

episodes.name: Dad Comes Back (2)
episodes.overview: Barbara naively announces the reconciliation of her father and her mother. (Part 2 of 2)

episodes.name: The Runaways (1)
episodes.overview: Julie turns to her boyfriend when she and her mother reach an impasse regarding education, employment and marriage.  (Part 1 of 4)

episodes.name: The Runaways (2)
episodes.overview: Ann is overcome by guilt after Chuck and Julie run away. (Part 2 of 4)

episodes.name: The Runaways (3)
episodes.overview: Schneider uses CB radio to search for Julie and her boyfriend.   (Part 3 of 4)

episodes.name: The Runaways (4)
episodes.overview: Their possessions stolen, runaways Julie and her boyfriend consider calling Barbara for help. (Part 4 of 4)

episodes.name: Barbara's Emergence
episodes.overview: Hoping to attract desirable males, Barbara decides to change her image.

episodes.name: David's New Job (1)
episodes.overview: David returns from Los Angeles with a job offer and hopes of marrying Ann. (Part 1 of 2)

episodes.name: David's New Job (2)
episodes.overview: As David works on Barbara and Julie, and as they pressure Ann to consider marrying David, Ann is faced with a serious decision..... she is not ready to marry again. David goes on without her.

episodes.name: The Upholstery Ripoff
episodes.overview: Ann must deal with an upholstery ripoff that invades her home.

episodes.name: Schneider's Pride and Joy
episodes.overview: Schneider touts his visiting nephew as a model gentleman, unaware that the youth is a thief.

episodes.name: A Visit from Dad
episodes.overview: Ann's visiting father tries to persuade her to return home.

episodes.name: The Maestro
episodes.overview: Ann finds herself attracted to the piano player who has moved into the building.

episodes.name: Happy New Year
episodes.overview: The girls put on a New Year's show at a retirement home.

episodes.name: J.C. and Julie (1)
episodes.overview: Julie's religious zeal is driving Ann and Barbara crazy. First of two parts.

episodes.name: J.C. and Julie (2)
episodes.overview: Julie applies her religious zeal to a drunken derelict, whom she found in a garbage can. Conclusion.

episodes.name: The New Car
episodes.overview: Ann won't allow her ex-husband to spoil Julie and Barbara with a new car.

episodes.name: Schneider Loves Ginny
episodes.overview: Schneider expects Ginny to leap at his marriage proposal.

episodes.name: Ginny's Child
episodes.overview: Ginny is always depressed after her mysterious Sunday excursions.

episodes.name: Julie's Operation
episodes.overview: With the family doctor away and Julie down with possible appendicitis, Ann accepts the services of a young resident.

episodes.name: The Traveling Salesperson
episodes.overview: Ann's boss has second thoughts about a woman's ability to handle the job he just gave to Ann.

episodes.name: The Butterfields
episodes.overview: Julie writes Chuck a Dear John letter, while Ann finds herself in the middle of a feud between Chuck's parents.

episodes.name: Barbara Plus Two
episodes.overview: Barbara accepts an invitation to a school dance, then can't turn another one down.

episodes.name: The Singles Bar
episodes.overview: Ginny persuades Ann to go to a singles bar.

episodes.name: The College Question
episodes.overview: Tired from cramming for entrance exams, Julie doesn't want to go to college anymore.

episodes.name: The Girls Alone (a.k.a.) Where's Mama?
episodes.overview: ""Barbera""and ""Julie""want to sneak out to a party on a school night.This occurs,while""Ms.Romano""is away on a business trip to Las Vegas.But the girls are fearful that their mother might find out that they're heading to the party and their beaus(Especially ""Cliff Randell"").So they try to reach their mother via a phone call.But they find out that ""Ms.Romano""didn't reach her hotel.This is one episode.Where both Ms.Philips and Ms.Bertinelli's characters show another side to their characters and to the characters'relationship.That there is a warm and caring friendship to these two young women and not an angry rivelry.

episodes.name: The Older Man (1)
episodes.overview: After Julie plows into a car, its dashing driver offers her a job. First of four parts.

episodes.name: The Older Man (2)
episodes.overview: Julie's boss invites her on an out-of-town trip. Second of four parts.

episodes.name: The Older Man (3)
episodes.overview: Julie is startled by her boss's proposal. Third of four parts.

episodes.name: The Older Man (4)
episodes.overview: Julie is implored by her father not to marry her 42-year-old boss. Conclusion.

episodes.name: Ann's Out-of-Town Client
episodes.overview: A lecherous client has more than business on his mind.

episodes.name: Bob Loves Barbara
episodes.overview: An insecure boy interested in dating Barbara bolsters his confidence by taking out a notorious classmate first.

episodes.name: The Second Mrs. Cooper
episodes.overview: After Julie and Barbara return home from a weekend visit with their dad complaining that Dad's new wife is trying to cut them out of his life, Ann initiates her first face to face meeting with the new Mrs. Cooper - only to learn that the girls haven't exactly been fair or kind to their new step-mother.

episodes.name: The Ghost Writer
episodes.overview: When Barbara hands in Julie's verse as her own for a class, a school counselor takes her for a poetic genius.

episodes.name: Barbara's Friend (1)
episodes.overview: While agonizes over whether Cliff Randall will invite her to the Grateful Dead concert, she has to contend with a over-eager girl trying to be her friend.  When reality sinks in,  she reaches out to Barbara at the last moment.

episodes.name: Barbara's Friend (2)
episodes.overview: Barbara's classmate phones to say she's taken a drug overdose. Conclusion.

episodes.name: Schneider's Kid
episodes.overview: Julie runs into an attractive young man in the lobby who is looking for Schneider.  However, his visit to see Schneider is anything but a social call when he reveals that he is Schneider's son, from a brief marriage 20 years earlier.  Ann, Barbara and Julie quickly do their best to prepare Schneider for the news.

episodes.name: Ann's Crisis
episodes.overview: Ann sees her 36th birthday as a crisis, not a cause for celebration.

episodes.name: The Race Driver (1)
episodes.overview: Schneider makes the grand announcement that a celebrity has just moved into the building, a race car driver named Cam Randolph.  Meanwhile, Julie and Barbara have devised a meeting between their mother and Cam, but Ann is anything but excited about meeting him, at first that is.  Things start to change however, once she gets to know him and she invites him over for dinner.

episodes.name: The Race Driver (2)
episodes.overview: Ann begins to question her relationship with a dashing race driver. Second of two parts.

episodes.name: Ann's Secretary
episodes.overview: Ann learns that a secretary she just hired is a reputed drug user.

episodes.name: Barbara's Rebellion
episodes.overview: Frustrated over not getting enough attention at home, Barbara rebells by running away to a Chicago motel room with Bob Morton.

episodes.name: The New Owner
episodes.overview: Determined to keep his job, Schneider woos the building's new owner â€” who falls for him.

episodes.name: Ann's Competitor
episodes.overview: Ann has a competitor in the lecherous Francine Webster.

episodes.name: The Dress Designer
episodes.overview: Aspiring designer Julie tries to enter a fashion show after the entry deadline.

episodes.name: Take the Money
episodes.overview: Barbara and Julie are excited about getting a new stereo and decide to buy Schneider's old one for $200.  However, as they are scrounging up the money, Julie checks her balance in her checking account and quickly finds that somehow an additional $125 has been credited to her account.  Stricken with guilt and Barbara's encouragement, Julie decides to take the money.

episodes.name: Barbara the Fink
episodes.overview: Barbara is an eyewitness to a vandalism at the school and soon finds herself between a rock and a hard place, over whether or not to do the honest thing and tell the truth and fink on a friend or not say anything.  Ultimately, she tells the truth but then must face the results of her actions, possible alienation.

episodes.name: Julie's Big Move (1)
episodes.overview: Julie plans to move out, but Ann doubts her daughter can make it financially. First of two parts.

episodes.name: Julie's Big Move (2)
episodes.overview: Conclusion. Ann thinks Julie's new roommate is a bad influence on her.

episodes.name: Ann, the Father
episodes.overview: Ann's career advice to Barbara's friend leads to hard feelings between the boy and his father.

episodes.name: Father, Dear Father (1)
episodes.overview: Ann's ex-husband tells her that he can no longer pay her child support for his daughters.

episodes.name: Father, Dear Father (2)
episodes.overview: Ed is forced to admit the truth to Julie and Barbara.

episodes.name: Ann's Friend
episodes.overview: Ann is stunned when a friend says she's leaving her husband.

episodes.name: Bob's New Girl
episodes.overview: Barbara has been steadily dating Cliff and soon finds herself trying to gently discourage Bob from pursuing her.  However, Bob is sure he can win her away from Cliff, that's when Ann encourages Bob to perhaps date other women.  He does but Barbara's reaction to Bob's new girlfriend is incredibly telling.

episodes.name: Schneider's Helper
episodes.overview: While he's recovering from a back injury, Schneider needs an assistant maintenance man to help out with his work around the building.  Barbara suggests that Schneider hire her disabled friend, Jackie.  Schneider reluctantly takes on the kid who does his best to prove he can do the job.  However, when there is a gas leak in the building, Jackie's competence is put to the test.

episodes.name: Yes, Sir, That's My Baby
episodes.overview: Sally, an old school friend of Barbara's shows up for a visit with some news, she's now a mother.  Originally, she agreed with the father to give the baby up for adoption but after one look at the baby, decided to keep it.  However, the big bombshell is dropped when she mentions that the father is Cliff Randall, Barbara's boyfriend.

episodes.name: The Dating Game (a.k.a.) Ann's Dating Game
episodes.overview: Ann is interested in a business associate but isn't quite sure how to convey her romantic interest to him.  Barbara and Julie suggest that she just make the first move and call him, which she does.  However, he isn't quite getting the hints and assumes that when she asks him out the dinner is business instead of pleasure.

episodes.name: Peabody's War
episodes.overview: ""Mr.Peabody"".An elderly resident in the ""Romano's""apartment building refuses to pay higher rent to allow the building's owners to throw him out.Because he is old and disabled.He locks himself in ""The Romano's Apartment""with a shotgun and will hold the family hostage.Until he can get on tv and tell the buildings owners to allow him to stay in his apartment and pay a fair rent price for it.On a sad not,this was Mr.J.Pat O'Malley's last tv performance.He would spend his last years living at The Motion Picture and TV Home in Woodland Hills,Ca.,Until his death in 1986.

episodes.name: Jealousy (1)
episodes.overview: Julie and Barbara become rivals when they fall for the leader of a rock group. First of two parts.

episodes.name: Jealousy (2)
episodes.overview: Conclusion. The battle for the band leader continues as Barbara tries to win him back from Julie.

episodes.name: The Arab Connection
episodes.overview: Ann plays hostess to an Arab sheik while Julie leads a demonstration against his country's economic policy.

episodes.name: Hold the Mustard
episodes.overview: The pace of Barbara's restaurant job proves to be faster than she anticipated.

episodes.name: Girl Talk
episodes.overview: Ann and the girls spend a warm Christmas Eve in a frigid mountain cabin.

episodes.name: The Married Man (1)
episodes.overview: In the first of a three-part story, Ann and a sportswriter begin a promising romance.

episodes.name: The Married Man (2)
episodes.overview: In the second of a three-part story, a smooth-sailing romance between Ann and a sportswriter hits the rocks.

episodes.name: The Married Man (3)
episodes.overview: Ann considers pursuing a relationship with her married sports writer, but soon concludes that to do so would strip her of her self respect.

episodes.name: Going Nowhere
episodes.overview: Julie is depressed because her designing career seems to have reached a dead end.

episodes.name: Francine Strikes Again
episodes.overview: Francine uses her feminine wiles to wrest away one of Ann's big accounts.

episodes.name: The Dental Hygienist
episodes.overview: Only hours after they meet, Ann's old pal and Schneider are ready to sail off on a romantic cruise.

episodes.name: The Piano Teacher
episodes.overview: The baby grand delivered to Ann by mistake belongs to her next-door neighbor, a slightly unstrung piano teacher who begins giving lessons in her living room.

episodes.name: The Broken Nose
episodes.overview: Barbara learns a lesson about beauty after Schneider accidentally opens a door smack into her nose.

episodes.name: Mad for Each Other
episodes.overview: Julie falls for an egotistical filmmaker whose temperament exactly matches her own.

episodes.name: The Graduation
episodes.overview: Barbara's high school graduation has arrived and she's all excited, except for two issues.  First, she's unsure if she wants to attend the University of Wisconsin, like her father did and second she's up in arms, trying to make a decision on whether to hang out at a party with friends or one with just family after graduation.

episodes.name: Fear of Success
episodes.overview: A lucrative offer to direct public relations for a computer firm prompts Ann to give Mr. Davenport two weeks' notice.

episodes.name: Grandma Leaves Grandpa
episodes.overview: Ann is all set to go away for the weekend to a ski lodge, however her plans are put to a halt when Grandma Romano drops by with the announcement that she's left Ann's father and now would like to stay with Ann and the girls.  Not quite taking her seriously, Ann is dealt a blow of reality when her father drops by needing a place to stay as well.

episodes.name: Schneider Gets Fired
episodes.overview: Schneider quits because the landlord refuses his raise request.

episodes.name: Back to School
episodes.overview: Barbara has begun her college education and feels very independent, balancing school work with social activities.  Meanwhile, Ann begins to feel undereducated as she hears Barbara's experiences and makes a decision to go to college.  The big surprise comes when she is taking the same course as Barbara.

episodes.name: Pressure
episodes.overview: Barbara's latest boyfriend, Brad is putting the pressure on her big time to have sex.  Barbara honestly does not know what to do and isn't quite sure she wants to accommodate his sexual demands but at the same time doesn't want to lose him.  So, she decides that perhaps she should and goes out and buys some contraceptives.

episodes.name: Julie's Wedding (1)
episodes.overview: Julie returns from a ski trip sporting a meek fiance, an impending wedding date and an unexcited best man.

episodes.name: Julie's Wedding (2)
episodes.overview: Best man Max insists that his amorous intentions toward Julie are honorable, even as the wedding party assembles.

episodes.name: Home Again, Home Again
episodes.overview: Newlyweds Julie and Max return from their honeymoon to an apartment they can't afford because Max has been laid off from his job.

episodes.name: Between Mother and Daughter
episodes.overview: A psychiatrist recommends a heart-to-heart talk to take the heat out of Ann's relationship with her mother.

episodes.name: Small Wonder
episodes.overview: Barbara hires a genetics tutor, unaware of his obvious shortcomings.

episodes.name: Et tu, Ann
episodes.overview: Ann pressures her assistant into working on a Saturday night â€” at her place.

episodes.name: A Little Larceny
episodes.overview: Barbara tries to earn some extra money by selling football betting cards.  However, Schneider gets arrested when Barbara involves him in her illegal football pool activities.

episodes.name: Heart Attack
episodes.overview: After Ann rushes out to yet another appointment, her family shouldn't be so surprised to learn she has suffered a heart attack.

episodes.name: Male Jealousy
episodes.overview: A feud erupts between Schneider and Max for male dominance in the Romano household as well as the attention of Ann and the girls.

episodes.name: Happy New Year II
episodes.overview: Ann and the family put on another show at the senior citizen hotel.

episodes.name: Schneider, the Model
episodes.overview: After a man-on-the-street chat with a newscaster, Schneider is offered a job as a male model, but becomes depressed when he learns the role he is to portray.

episodes.name: Triple Play
episodes.overview: A fast talking insurance man from Buffalo can't decide whether he would rather romance Barbara, Ann or Grandma Romano.

episodes.name: So Long, Mom (a.k.a.) Not Telling
episodes.overview: Barbara's desire to live near campus and Max's new job in Houston have Ann pondering the thought of living alone for the first time in her life.

episodes.name: Old Horizons
episodes.overview: Grandma Romano moves to Indianapolis, takes an apartment in Ann's building and finds a job in her office.

episodes.name: Endless Elliot
episodes.overview: Barbara is harassed by an overzealous suitor.

episodes.name: Retrospective (1)
episodes.overview: The topsy-turvy years in Schneider's building are fondly remembered (in clips from past shows) when condominium conversion threatens to disperse the tenants.

episodes.name: Retrospective (2)
episodes.overview: Schneider, Ann and the girls continue to reminisce about the past as the construction of condominiums seems to be a sure thing.

episodes.name: Girl with a Past
episodes.overview: Barbara feels compelled to tell Bob about his new girlfriend's former exploits.

episodes.name: Perils of Plastic
episodes.overview: A binge of credit-card spending leads Max and Julie to insolvency.

episodes.name: No Laughing Matter
episodes.overview: After Schneider's rebuff during an outing to a comedy club, Ann brings home a footloose funny man.

episodes.name: Connor's Crisis
episodes.overview: Ann's boss, Mr. Connors is going through a rough time after his wife walks out on him, citing that he has become too boring for her taste.  To cheer him up, Ann invites him out to dinner but when Schneider crashes the dinner, Mr. Connors gets some lessons in picking up the ladies and ends up with a gold-digger.

episodes.name: Grecian Yearn
episodes.overview: Ann's archeology professor offers her love and companisonship and asks her to live with him Greece.

episodes.name: Pen Pals
episodes.overview: Schneider's cell mate from a gambling bust shows up and demands first class treatment or else.

episodes.name: The Spirit is Willing
episodes.overview: While Schneider is making love to his girlfriend, she has a heart attack which ultimately leaves Schneider impotent.  Schneider then goes to great lengths to remedy his problem to no avail.  That is until Ann makes a suggestion concerning an ex-flame of Schneider's, but Schneider is unsure if he wants to take her advice.

episodes.name: Teacher's Pet
episodes.overview: Barbara went all out on a paper for a government class and ends up with a D.  When she goes in to see her professor, she soon discovers, that she certainly can get a higher grade on her paper, that is if she accepts her professor's advances.  Later, Barbara determines to bring him to justice and files a complaint against him.

episodes.name: The Amarillo Connection
episodes.overview: Thanks to Ann's hard work, Connors & Davenport has just landed a brand new account and Ann is all excited about the possibilities of a promotion.  She soon finds herself battling with Francine over it, but ultimately she gets it, but soon discovers she'd rather not have it, since it means moving to Amarillo, Texas.

episodes.name: Ann Meets Nick (1)
episodes.overview: Ann's attempts to land her own advertising accounts lead to repeated run-ins with an irritating commercial artist.

episodes.name: Ann Meets Nick (2)
episodes.overview: Ann and Nick do so well on their first campaign that he wants to form a partnership with her.

episodes.name: Farewell, My Suite
episodes.overview: Ann and Barbara return from a weekend trip to find they've been robbed with Schneider's assistance.

episodes.name: Merry Widow
episodes.overview: Ann's father has died and her mother is chronically depressed until Schneider takes her out on the town.

episodes.name: The Drop Out
episodes.overview: Barbara's search for an interesting major leads her to the conclusion that she's not ready to continue her education.

episodes.name: A Shot in the Dark
episodes.overview: Former tenants ask Schneider to help them conceive a child through artificial insemination.

episodes.name: Sunday Father
episodes.overview: Alex is fed up with Nick's plans for their father-and-son weekends.

episodes.name: November Song (1)
episodes.overview: Schneider falls madly in love with a woman who prizes her freedom above everything.

episodes.name: November Song (2)
episodes.overview: Schneider is overcome by jealousy at the thought of going fishing while his young girlfriend is alone with a man her own age.

episodes.name: Five Fingered Discount
episodes.overview: An old family secret surfaces when Grandma Romano gets pinched for shoplifting.

episodes.name: I Do, I Do
episodes.overview: Barbara joins a committee to assist a young man about to lose his immigration status, which could condemn him to prison in his native land.

episodes.name: Out of Bounds
episodes.overview: Ann is convinced that her constant bickering with business partner Nick is related to sexual tension.

episodes.name: A Tiny Romance
episodes.overview: Beerbelly's wife, dissatisfied with her marriage, makes a play for Schneider.

episodes.name: Once a Mom
episodes.overview: Ann has the flu and the last thing she wants is for her mother to play nursemaid.

episodes.name: Alex's Project
episodes.overview: Nick won't let Alex get away with turning in a shoddy science project.

episodes.name: Caveat Emptor
episodes.overview: A new account is going well for Ann and Nick until they realize the merchant is involved in a bait-and-switch scheme.

episodes.name: Small Wonder II
episodes.overview: A child who once tutored Barbara has graduated from college, but can't find a job, at age 14.

episodes.name: Wicked Ann
episodes.overview: Alex begins to resent Ann's relationship with his father and accuses her of keeping his father and mother apart.

episodes.name: Indianapolis Story
episodes.overview: Nick and Ann manage to get the apartment to themselves, only to have Ann's old boyfriend David arrive at their door.

episodes.name: Alex Moves In
episodes.overview: After the recent death of Nick, Alex is left feeling lonely and unwanted by his recently married mother. So, he hops a bus from Chicago and head straight to Ann and Barbara.

episodes.name: Airport
episodes.overview: Awaiting Ann's overdue flight, everyone passes time in fleeting encounters with the opposite sex.

episodes.name: Shake Hands
episodes.overview: Ann's old nemesis Francine insists that she would make a perfect partner, a prospect Ann finds revolting.

episodes.name: Julie Shows Up (1)
episodes.overview: Julie shows up unexpectedly, toting all her posessions and spouting unlikely tales of Max's infidelity.

episodes.name: Julie Shows Up (2)
episodes.overview: Julie and Max seem headed for divorce unless someone like Ann can persuade them to talk it out.

episodes.name: Dinner at Seven (1)
episodes.overview: Barbara schedules back to back dates with two guys but the first won't take her home.

episodes.name: Dinner at Seven (2)
episodes.overview: Barbara hatches a plan to repay Mark for their disastrous first date.

episodes.name: Plain Favorite
episodes.overview: Schneider contemplates taking Ann's cousin to a dance.

episodes.name: Alex's First Love
episodes.overview: Alex's first date rekindles the protectionist approach Ann took with her daughters.

episodes.name: Not So Silent Partner
episodes.overview: Schneider becomes the not-so-silent business partner of Ann and Francine after the bank turns down their loan.

episodes.name: Gift Horses
episodes.overview: While Ann is away, Barbara's grandmothers wage a war of presents for her affection.

episodes.name: Stick 'em Up
episodes.overview: Unwelcome guests arrive just in time for Barbara's surprise birthday party at the store.

episodes.name: Ann's Failure
episodes.overview: Ann is sorely troubled by intimations of her own mortality that are triggered by Barbara's engagement.

episodes.name: Grandma's Nest Egg
episodes.overview: Francine's father and Grandma Romano are a hot item until she learns his line of work.

episodes.name: Barbara's Crisis
episodes.overview: Barbara fears that her marriage plans will dissolve after she learns that she can't conceive a child.

episodes.name: Mrs. O'Leary's Kid
episodes.overview: Alex doesn't feel like the hero he's hailed after saving lives in an apartment blaze because he caused the fire in the first place.

episodes.name: Diamonds Are Forever
episodes.overview: The men go fishing and the women await their return, but all have one thing in common, they're talking about marriage.

episodes.name: The Defector
episodes.overview: A Russian women's basketball team visits Ann's home and one of the stars decides to defect and marry Schneider.

episodes.name: Meow, Meow
episodes.overview: Ann and Francine battle over the same man.

episodes.name: Hardball
episodes.overview: Alex talks Max into coaching his baseball team and Max's first action as coach is to bench Alex.

episodes.name: Vegas (1)
episodes.overview: At a dentistry convention in Las Vegas, Barbara and Mark consider avoiding the hassle of wedding arrangements with a quickie Vegas marriage ceremony.

episodes.name: Vegas (2)
episodes.overview: The family rushes off to Las Vegas to talk Barbara out of a quickie marriage ceremony.

episodes.name: Orville and Emily
episodes.overview: The annual variety show for the Park Utopia senior-citizens hotel takes place.

episodes.name: Hear Today, Gone Tomorrow
episodes.overview: It's coming through loud and clear, Schneider's going deaf.

episodes.name: It's in the Cards
episodes.overview: Grandma Romano tries her hand at a new career, fortunetelling.

episodes.name: The Perfect Wedding (1)
episodes.overview: Barbara's nerves are on edge as her wedding day approaches and husband-to-be Mark is no help, he's more interested in his golf game than helping with the preparations.

episodes.name: The Perfect Wedding (2)
episodes.overview: Mark refuses to cancel his golf game and Barbara's worried he won't get to the church on time.

episodes.name: Honeymoon's Over
episodes.overview: Barbara tries to adapt to life at Mark's rooming house, where her new husband's friends, including a scantily clad woman, breeze in and out without knocking to use the bathroom, or asking to use the closet and community refrigerator.

episodes.name: Catcher in the Mud
episodes.overview: Believing Alex needs a father figure and more male influence, Schneider and his beer-guzzling buddies take him to a female mud-wrestling show.

episodes.name: Last Time I Saw Paris
episodes.overview: To land a new French account, Francine talks Ann into a weekend trip to Paris to learn about the French market.

episodes.name: Auntie Francine
episodes.overview: Ann may be a little envious of Francine's freewheeling lifestyle, especially after Francine takes Alex for the weekend and shows him the time of his life.

episodes.name: Lovers & Other Parents
episodes.overview: Barbara's scheme to get her mother and Mark's newly divorced father together at a dinner party gets faster results than she anticipated.

episodes.name: Miracle of Birth (1)
episodes.overview: Julie's announcement that her baby will be born underwater may be more than Ann can bear.

episodes.name: Miracle of Birth (2)
episodes.overview: Julie insists on flying to California to have her baby in an underwater birth tank but her labor pains are beginning at her mother's home in Indianapolis.

episodes.name: First Things First
episodes.overview: Barbara's decision to enroll in college forces the Royers to live on a shoestring budget with little time for romance.

episodes.name: Pride and Privacy (1)
episodes.overview: Forced out of their rooming house by an explosion, Barbara and Mark impose on Ann for a temporary home until they can find a place of their own.

episodes.name: Pride and Privacy (2)
episodes.overview: With Julie, Max and the new baby also needing a place to live, Ann may be forced to leave her own home to preserve her sanity and her relationship with Sam.

episodes.name: Pride and Privacy (3)
episodes.overview: Unable to cope with the pandemonium at her house, Ann takes refuge at Sam's place, until he offers her a solution for which she's completely unprepared.

episodes.name: The Cruise
episodes.overview: Grandma Romano returns from a vacation cruise with news that she's marrying the shipboard piano player.

episodes.name: Spare the Child
episodes.overview: Alex's video game fascination has him skipping school and facing punishment from the principal, and may be symptomatic of hidden emotional problems.

episodes.name: The Hero
episodes.overview: Saving a businessman's life earns Schneider executive status in a job, complete with a secretary, a plush office, a rent-free apartment nearby and very little work to do.

episodes.name: The Good Life
episodes.overview: A South Pacific island would be just the ticket for Sam, if only Ann would drop her work, desert the family and join him in paradise.

episodes.name: Social Insecurity
episodes.overview: Determined not to be a burden on anyone, Grandma Romano keeps her escalating financial problems from Ann.

episodes.name: A Young Man's Fancy
episodes.overview: Approaching his 15th birthday, Alex anticipates his first female encounter.  But when he strikes out with the school's ""girl most likely to,"" he makes a play for an older woman.

episodes.name: The Letter
episodes.overview: A letter to Ann's mother from her father, mailed the day before he died, is delivered four years later.

episodes.name: Buyer's Remorse
episodes.overview: Barbara's newly friend Bob reveals he still has feelings for her.

episodes.name: Sonny Boy
episodes.overview: A weekend outing with a girl from school is more attractive to Alex than the father-son night he agreed to attend at Schneider's lodge.

episodes.name: Panzini
episodes.overview: Schneider feels threatened when his lookalike, a top Sicilian designer sweeps Francine off her feet.

episodes.name: Sisters
episodes.overview: Mark and Max rent a house without consulting their wives.

episodes.name: Second Time Around
episodes.overview: Sam unilaterally sets a wedding date as Ann learns from his newspaper announcement that she's getting married in three days.  But it's Sam who starts getting cold feet.

episodes.name: Honeymoon II
episodes.overview: Ann and Sam's ski honeymoon quickly goes downhill when Ann loses her luggage and Sam injures his back on the ski lift.

episodes.name: Shakedown
episodes.overview: Sam and Ann are adjusting to married life and find they disagree on monumental issues such as where the spoons should be kept.

episodes.name: Take My Ex
episodes.overview: A visit from Sam's ex-wife sparks a sudden need for attention in Ann, who resents the pampering the former Mrs. Royer recieves from Sam.

episodes.name: The Dentist
episodes.overview: The opening of his new dental office gives Mark such a case of the jitters that he may give up his practice before the first patient walks through the door.

episodes.name: The Bedtime Story
episodes.overview: A plan to collaborate on the writing of children's stories drives Julie and Max into a bitter feud over Max's potential as a writer.

episodes.name: Worried Heart
episodes.overview: Ann's imagination runs away with her when Sam runs off on a business trip with an associate who happens to be his ex-girlfriend.

episodes.name: Baby Love (1)
episodes.overview: A weekend watching little Annie for Max and Julie has Barbara longing to have her own baby and begins considering the option of adoption.

episodes.name: Baby Love (2)
episodes.overview: Barbara, still wanting to have a child, continues to consider adoption.

episodes.name: Travel Agent
episodes.overview: To arrange a long-overdue vacation, Barbara and Mark visit a travel agency, where Barbara finds an unexpected career opportunity.

episodes.name: Not a Creature Was Staying
episodes.overview: Ann has the holiday blues, believing she and Sam will be alone on Christmas, but Sam plans to surprise her with a Caribbean cruise.

episodes.name: Sam's Apartment
episodes.overview: Sam's late night disappearance has the family convinced he's been kidnapped until Ann learns he's kept his old apartment.

episodes.name: Never Hire a Relative
episodes.overview: Francine goes behind Ann's back to talk Sam into designing an elaborate office suite that's too grandiose for Ann's taste.

episodes.name: Fifty
episodes.overview: Schneider has a sentimental reunion with his high-school love, who pays him a visit on his 50th birthday, bringing along her own cherished memories of their past.

episodes.name: Woman of the House
episodes.overview: Barbara loses charge of her household when Grandma Romano moves in with her own set of rules, menus, meal schedules and a collection of cuckoo clocks.

episodes.name: Parting Company
episodes.overview: Ann and Francine's business relationship is threatened when Francine announces she's marrying an ad executive Ann doesn't trust.

episodes.name: Ave Romano
episodes.overview: An Italian priest arrives unexpectedly at the Royers, claiming to be a distant relative of Grandma Romano.

episodes.name: Bringing in the Clowns
episodes.overview: Mark's jokester friends are visiting and taking their jokes too far to the point where everyone gets sick of them. Barbara gets so fed up that she tries to teach them a lesson by ""getting hurt.""

episodes.name: Up in Smoke
episodes.overview: After six years of not smoking, Sam lights up.  But when he tries to quit, he finds his willpower has gone up in smoke.

episodes.name: Meaning of Life
episodes.overview: Schneider gets a new lease on life after he's accidentally electrocuted, then revived, a hair raising experience in which he claims he died and came back to life.

episodes.name: The Nearness of You
episodes.overview: Working side by side at the travel agency spawns a growing attraction between Max and Barbara, that becomes impossible to ignore.

episodes.name: Off We Go
episodes.overview: Ann gets a job offer in London and ponders taking it. Despite getting nagged by her mother, she decides to accept the job.  This leads her to wonder how she's going to tell the rest of her family that she's leaving.

episodes.name: Another Man's Shoes
episodes.overview: Schneider learns that his brother passed away and that somebody needs to take care of his nephew and niece so Schneider gets a phone call to come and pick them up. The place where he arrives is a carnival like place with circus like people. This place needs repairs and some ""manly guidance"" so everyone tries to persuade Schneider to move there and with Ann gone and the kids grown up, Schneider finally accepts the move.

episodes.name: One Day at a Time Reunion
